poem:
A Matter of Life and Death  

In the theatre's orbit, Peter floats above,  
a flicker mid-air, beneath tattered stars,  
his voice dances with June's like rare love,  
parachute's gone, fate's doors ajar.  

Between static breaths they weave a tether,  
lives crossed in flight, time hums together—  
a moonlit walk through clouds of thin weather.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
